In-class Exercise 5

Modified

December 16, 2023

devtools::install_github("LukeCe/spflow")
pacman::p_load(sf, sp, httr, knitr, tidyverse, Matrix, spdep, reshape2, tmap, spflow)
mpsz_nb <- read_rds("data/rds/mpsz_nb.rds")
mpsz_flow <- read_rds("data/rds/mpsz_flow.rds")
mpsz_var <- read_rds("data/rds/mpsz_var.rds")
mpsz_net <- spflow_network(
  id_net = "sg",
  node_neighborhood =
    nb2mat(mpsz_nb$by_contiguity),
  node_data=mpsz_var,
  node_key_column= "SZ_CODE"
)

mpsz_net

Create a spflow_network-class() In spflow package,

mpsz_net_pairs <- spflow_network_pair(
  id_orig_net ="sf",
  id_dest_net = "sg",
  pair_data=mpsz_flow,
  orig_key_column = "ORIGIN_SZ",
  dest_key_column = "DESTIN_SZ"

)

mpsz_net_pairs

mpsz_multi_net <- spflow_network_multi(mpsz_net, mpsz_net_pairs)

Check independent variable pairs to gauge multi-colinearity Check dependent variable relationsiip with independent variable to check for relevance

  • pair_cor() to create a correlation matrix, and
  • cor_image()
cor_formula <- log(1+TRIPS) ~
  BUSSTOP_COUT+
  AGE7_12+
  AGE13_24+
  AGE_25_64+
  sCHOOL_COUNT +
  BUSINESS_COUNT +
  RETAILS_COUNT+
  FINSERV_COUT +
  P_(log(DISTANCE +1))
